metadata.description: Inventory - REQUIRED. Environment, including geographic location, for Power Automate - Ex for commercial: https://flow.microsoft.com/manage/environments/
AuditLogs - The audience for the HTTP connector. Set by Setup wizard based on tenant type
AuditLogs - The authority for the HTTP connector. Set by Setup wizard based on tenant type

If true, uses the AuditLogQuery api in Graph to gather audit logs. If false (default), continues to use the old Office 365 Management API to gather them. Default due to legacy behavior but its not the preferred technique due to lack of backend filtering.
Inventory - REQUIRED. The URL used to get graph information for your cloud. Ex https://graph.microsoft.com/
Number of minutes back to pull audit logs, default 65 will get one hour of data.

How far back in time to start looking for audit log records in number of minutes. The flow will start here and go back 65 minutes (configurable) to get logs from that period. Default 0 means that you will look for data points from this most recent hour. This gets you the most recent data but may miss logs as data can take up to 48 hours to fill in the the product logs. Value of 2820 gets you data from 48 hours ago, so your data will never be current but will always be complete

Get_env_var_for_AppID.description: must use old technique for fetching as env var is optional

Get_env_var_for_for_text_Secret.description: must use old technique for fetching as env var is optional

Get_env_var_for_for_Azure_Secret.description: must use old technique for fetching as env var is optional

runError.message: Audit Log query wait time exceeded

Set-InitialAuditLogQueryRecordsURL.description: This is first log events URL for the query and updated in the flow if results are paged

DidAllListAuditLogContentCallsFailed_2.description: If all HTTP calls of ListAuditlLogContent action failed then increment HTTP call failure count

DidAllListAuditLogContentCallsFailed.description: If all HTTP calls of ListAuditlLogContent action failed then increment HTTP call failure count

parameters.item/admin_flowinstanceurl: @concat(parameters('Power Automate Environment Variable (admin_PowerAutomateEnvironmentVariable)'), workflow()?['tags']['environmentName'], '/flows/', workflow()?['name'], '/runs/', workflow()?['run']['name'])

@concat(parameters('Power Automate Environment Variable (admin_PowerAutomateEnvironmentVariable)'), workflow()?['tags']['environmentName'], '/flows/', workflow()?['name'], '/runs/', workflow()?['run']['name'])

runError.message: One or more HTTP actions to fetch Audit Log events failed

Catch_-_not_ready_to_take_last_run_date.inputs: Catch - not ready to take last run date

AnyHttpCallFailures.description: If there are any HTTP call failures, then we do second error handling here

AuditLogQueryID.description: Audit Log query ID returned by the POST call to create new query. Used to get actual event log records after the query is completed

minutes_back.inputs: @mul(-1, min(60, parameters('Audit Logs - Minutes to Look Back (admin_AuditLogsMinutestoLookBack)')))

start_time_minutes_back.inputs: @mul(-1, add(min(60, parameters('Audit Logs - End Time Minutes Ago (admin_AuditLogsEndTimeMinutesAgo)')), parameters('Audit Logs - Minutes to Look Back (admin_AuditLogsMinutestoLookBack)')))

end_time_minutes_back.inputs: @mul(-1, parameters('Audit Logs - End Time Minutes Ago (admin_AuditLogsEndTimeMinutesAgo)'))
